ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basic principles of statistics as well as the software MINITAB.
A basic understanding of statistics beyond that of a high school statistics course.
How to use mini tab and interpret and utilize data
Basic statistical analysis techniques: everything from using graphs to analyze mean and median to understanding different sampling types and statistical experiment types

I learned a lot about the theory behind quantitative research and statistics.  I also learned how to actually do rudimentary statistics, touching on topics like experiment design, regression, and hypothesis testing.

A good understanding of the basic statistical concepts
Some good and useful data analysis skills
Basic knowledge of stats
Understanding of basic statistics and using minitab software.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is able to be taken at its own pace and has a lot of practice opportunities.

The course is asynchronous, which makes it a great course to enroll in for the summer. It can be challenging sometimes to stay engaged with the recorded lectures, however. The homework assignments and exams each were overall fair. The unit quizzes were low-pressure and keeps everyone accountable to stay on track in the course. JDRS is a great professor and is always very approachable with his many office hours hosted by him and each of the TFs. The TFs do sometimes make mistakes in grading, so it is important to utilize the regrade requests on Gradescope.

I love that there were so many hours of office hours available each week and Prof. JRS was always available to help.  It can be a bit tough actually staying on top of all the recorded lectures as its a bit tough to stay motivated when the class isn't live, but it certainly was convenient.

strengths:
1. excellent course structures
2. very clear explanations and homework greatly helps in understanding the knowledge learned in class
3. the video and audio is in very high quality

weakness:
1. maybe to provide more feedbacks on students homework
Its very fast paced
Great course all around! No complaints. Two major strengths were: how clear and engaging the lectures were and the availability of office hours.

Strengths: JDRS and organization of course! I found that the course was very well organized, which helped me stay on track during the faster pace of summer session. JDRS is awesome - super helpful and great at explaining new concepts. I also found it very helpful that there were so many office hours.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, It is great if you need a QR and aren't a STEM major.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. The knowledge gained in this course can be useful in a variety of contexts. It is also a great course to take over the summer. I had plenty of time to pursue other endeavors while taking this course over the summer.

I would certainly recommend this to any student that wants a better understanding of statistics, as its gives a really great introduction to the field.  It is great both for starting out stats majors as well as majors in any other field that uses quantitative research methods.

Yes, it is an excellent introductory statistical course with very clear explanations and meaningful content, covering all the basic statistical concepts. It is a very good course that is not only suitable for S&DS major students but also for students from other majors
Yes it is a reasonable course to take to satisfy a QR
Yes!
Definitely! The class gave me a solid understanding of basic statistics and statistical software. I also feel confident about how to apply the course material to other disciplines.

Yes, but only if you are willing to commit to the summer schedule. The class and prof are great, but it is very fast-paced (just because summer session is so condensed). Overall, this was a great class!

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I am really not sure.
I will be able to interpret data sets and use specific methods of graphs and models to further understand it in the future
This class will set the stage for future S&DS courses I intend to take. I plan to use knowledge from this course in the context of higher level science classes and research endeavors that I pursue.

I will definitely use this to better understand the methods used for quantitative research in my field.  Statistics is all over political science, so it will definitely help me better understand the numbers that people throw around and, more than anything, understand if they are good or faulty.
The statistical knowledge like ANOVA is very useful both in my data science internship and future study in data science major
I will likely use my new statistics knowledge and skills for future academic research and possibly in my career.
